availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James C. Howard (Kenton County, Kentucky, magistrate and public servant)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, clerk and public servant. Kentucky native. Married to Delia Peck Howard in Bourbon County on October 9, 1851. Father of Eugene Howard, Edwin J. Howard, Arthur Howard, Frank Howard, M. Lida Howard, and Jennie Howard. Clerk in Montgomery County in 1850. Magistrate in Kenton County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Kenton County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 7A.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 5, p. 169B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bourbon County Marriages, Film #000183145, p. 256.
